etymology.description: Two blocks of ice -> compressed and stylized as 冫
etymology.interpretation: The character 仌(bīng, "to be at peace") visually depicts two blocks of ice, symbolizing calmness and stillness akin to a serene, frozen state. The pictogram later evolved to represent the form 冫, commonly associated with ice-related meanings in compounds.

examples.chinese: 经过静心修行后(經過靜心修行後)，人自仌(人自𠔼)。
examples.pinyin: Jīngguò jìngxīn xiūxíng hòu, rén zì bīng.
examples.english: After practicing meditation, one becomes at peace.

examples.chinese: 他静坐冥想时(他靜坐冥想時)，心情仌(心情𠔼)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jìngzuò míngxiǎng shí, xīnqíng bīng.
examples.english: When he sits quietly in meditation, his mood is at peace.

examples.chinese: 远离烦嚣之后(遠離煩囂之後)，生活变得仌(生活變得𠔼)。
examples.pinyin: Yuǎn lí fánxiāo zhīhòu, shēnghuó biàn de bīng.
examples.english: After distancing oneself from the hustle and bustle, life becomes peaceful.
